newsitem.title: USA: Caliber signs agreement to sell part of unit.
newsitem.headline: Caliber signs agreement to sell part of unit.

text.p: Caliber System Inc said on Wednesday that it had signed a definitive agreement to sell the operations of its Viking Freight's Southwestern Division in a deal valued at $80 million.

Under the terms of the agreement, Caliber will receive $43 million in cash and will retain 35 properties it will sell at a later date, Caliber said in a statement. The division being sold, covering territory previously served by the former Central Freight Lines, will be bought by Central management and the Moyes Group of Swift Transportation, the company added.
In addition, the investor group, which will operate under the name Central Freight Lines Inc, will assume $22 million in liabilities, Caliber said.

The total value of the sale, including anticipated proceeds from the retained properties, is estimated at $80 million. The transaction is expected to close on or before June 30 and will have no impact on Caliber's future 1997 earings, the company said, adding that proceeds from the sale will go towards reducing outstanding debt.
Caliber System provides transportation, logistics and related information services.
